com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver

Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.Validator

  • public class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks to see if an expression or equation is valid.
    Author:
    Nateowami, Tribex

      • eqIsValid

        Tells whether a given equation is valid
        Parameters:
        equation - The equation to check
        Returns:
        true if the equation is valid, otherwise false

        Evaluates the algebraic validity of a give expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to check
        Returns:
        if the expression is valid

      • cutMultiplication

        private static boolean cutMultiplication(java.lang.String expr,
                        int cut)
        Validates both sides of an expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        cut - The index to cut at. The char at this index IS included in the first substring, unlike Validator.cut()
        Returns:
        if both sides of the expression are valid

      • termIsValid

        private static boolean termIsValid(java.lang.String term)
        Evaluates the algebraic validity of the given term. A term may have commas in its exponent.
        Parameters:
        term - The term to be evaluated
        Returns:
        If the term is valid

      • isNextCharOpenPar

        private static boolean isNextCharOpenPar(java.lang.String str,
                        int index)
        Figures out if the next char (after index) is is (, [, {, or <
        Parameters:
        str - The string to search through
        index - The index to start searching from
        Returns:
        true the next char is (, [, {, or <, false if it isn't or if the string has reached the end.

      • getEndOfPower

        private static int getEndOfPower(java.lang.String str,
                int index)
        Finds the index of the end of a power
        Parameters:
        str - The string to search in
        index - The index to start the search at
        Returns:
        The last char that is part of the power

      • findCutAtAdditionOrSubtraction

        private static int findCutAtAdditionOrSubtraction(java.lang.String expr)
        Finds the index of where a given expression has a + or - sign that is not nested
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        Returns:
        The index of non-nested addition or subtraction

      • findCutAtMultiplication

        private static int findCutAtMultiplication(java.lang.String expr)
        Finds the index of the last char in an expression that is multiplied by another. For example, if expr is (5)2(6) it will return 3.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        Returns:
        The index of non-nested multiplication

      • findCutAtDivision

        private static int findCutAtDivision(java.lang.String expr)
        Finds the index of where a given expression has a division sign that is not nested
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        Returns:
        The index of a non-nested division

      • cut

        private static boolean cut(java.lang.String expr,
          int cut)
        Validates both sides of an expression.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to evaluate
        cut - The index to cut at. The char at this index will not be in either of the sub strings
        Returns:
        if both sides of the expression are valid
